newsitem.title: USA: Miami, Fla., interim manager says will extend stay.
newsitem.headline: Miami, Fla., interim manager says will extend stay.

text.p: Acting Miami City Manager Merrett Stierheim has agreed to extend his stay on the job to November 15, city officials said Friday.
Stierheim, a former Dade County manager who heads the Greater Miami Convention and Visitors Bureau, had previously agreed to act as interim city manager until October 30.
Mayor Joe Carollo asked him to stay on because the city commission is still searching for a permanent city manager.
Stierheim replaced City Manager Cesar Odio, who resigned in September after federal prosecutors charged him with allegedly soliciting kickbacks in connection with city contracts.
Stierheim and a team of corporate and public finance volunteers are helping the city draft a plan to close a $68 million deficit in its $275 million budget for the year that began Oct 1.
